content: 1 different effects in the striping if you are just prepared to break these turns - compare the columns of colour highlighted inboxes a and b in a the colours form little sections where the colour doubles back on itself whereas in b each colour is allowed to stand proud of its neighbour and so you end up with five glorious colours in the column at the end instead of the three colour blocks caused by turning the colours back on themselves great stuff eh the solution of course is simple if you crochet or knit your scarf along its length figure 2 b rather than backwards and forwards across its width the colour will almost certainly have changed by some degree by the time you reach the other end this will not fix the problem of the colour turning the corner itself but it does make for a lovely scarf if you are prepared to snip that yarn ok less chatting more crocheting take a base chain of 120 stitches more if you are using a thinner yarn/smaller hook combo done good now leaving a tail of about 12cm 5 cut that yarn yup just cut and 2
